intro: Xaveria macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leaved xaveria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features large, broad leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Xaveria macrophylla is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
